content.title: Access Request & New Documents
content.visibleText:
Access Request & New Documents

1. Access to the intranet is restricted to employees only.
2. Employees must use their corporate email address to register.
3. Link to register: https://intranet.example.com/register
4. After registration, employees will receive an email with login details.
5. It is mandatory to complete the onboarding process within the first week.
6. The onboarding process includes several mandatory training sessions.
7. Employees must read and sign the employee handbook.
8. Link to employee handbook: https://intranet.example.com/handbook

Question How can I access the intranet from home?
2. What are the onboarding process requirements?

Further Info

For more detailed information, please contact Human Resources at hr@example.com or visit our intranet site.

content.title: Unconscious Customer
content.visibleText:
Unconscious Customer

Unconscious customer engagement roughly translates to a habitual purchasing process formed by the customer. When a customer engages in a habitual process, they are less likely to be influenced by competitive offers.

Because their past positive experiences have set their expectations for future experiences, they are less likely to seek alternatives or even consider new options. This type of engagement is powerful because it creates a strong emotional connection with the brand, which can be difficult to break.

Lack of Control

This type of engagement means losing control of their choices, leading to an unconscious loyalty to a brand. Customers are not actively making a decision to stay with a brand; rather, they are passively continuing because it has become a habit.

What did the customers struggle most with?

Customer Needs: Aligning customer needs with business goals is a key component. Customers often have different expectations, which can lead to misunderstandings and poor service. Properly aligning these expectations with the company's capabilities is crucial in maintaining customer loyalty.

For example, a customer who expects high-quality products may be disappointed if the company's actual offerings are of lower quality than expected. This can lead to dissatisfaction and eventually, loss of the customer.

Suggestions for Improvement: To improve customer engagement, companies should focus on creating a more conscious engagement strategy. This involves being more aware of customer needs and actively working to meet them, rather than relying on habitual loyalty.

The report states: 'To have a balanced mix of educational, and high-value tasks keeps members engaged.'
